intro: Cirsium zugazae, commonly known as the Zugazá Cirsium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, Cirsium zugazae is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
